transcript:
Patient: I've been trying to complete the thought records as you suggested, but I find it challenging to identify the cognitive distortions in the moment. I often only recognize them after I've already been dwelling on the negative thoughts for a while.

Therapist: That's a common challenge many people face when first starting with thought records. It takes practice to develop the skill of identifying cognitive distortions in real-time. One helpful strategy is to set aside a specific time each day to review your thoughts and look for patterns of distortions. With regular practice, it will become easier to catch them in the moment. Let's take a look at one of your thought records from the past week. Can you share an example of a situation where you struggled to identify the distortion?
